content: Was working perfectly until a couple of months ago. Now logs me out and will not recognise my login. Have to uninstall, reinstall. Happens every 2-3 days.
replyContent: Hi Michael, We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience. There is an update available on the Play Store that will resolve this issue. Contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au for further assistance.

content: Hi Guys, thanks for your great product. Is there any chance of a no sign in option? Sign in bug again after every update.
replyContent: Hi Bruce, we have a new update on the Play Store that will resolve this login issue. We've been having performance issues in the last month or so, and are in the midst of reviewing and upgrading the app environment. Please try the update and let us know how it goes, contact us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au

content: Frequently signs you out (appears to be after each update). So notifications stop, then I personally forget to take any meds for a couple of days because I don't realise. Going to find another strategy.
replyContent: Hi Tara, we apologise for this. It's been affecting a subset of our users. We have fixed this issue in the latest release. Please update the app and let us know how you go on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au We hope you'll reconsider the rating once you've updated to the latest release. Regards, MedicineWise App support.

content: Excellent
replyContent: Thank you Mark. It is delightful to hear such positive words and it’s always a pleasure to serve our users. If you have any further suggestions or comments please drop us an email on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au Regards, MedicineWise app support team.

content: I missed my dose 3 times, keeps logging out automatically when med is once a week. Useless.
replyContent: Hi Haitham, Sorry for this inconvenience. We have fixed the issue. Please update to the latest version on the Play Store. And if we can be of anymore assistance please contact us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au

content: useless application, a good idea, that has been terribly executed. IMHO a waste of tax payers money. All my medications couldn't be added because it didnt recognise the barcodes. Adding family members doesnt mean they get access to the same info. adding statistics and test results doesnt allow you to see trends oe ar historical information.
replyContent: Dear Hany, The app is undergoing improvements based on consumer feedback which includes your above suggestions. We are working hard on continually increasing barcode scan-able medicines on our medicines database. However, the majority of medicines can be found using the medicines finder. Contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au for further assistance.

content: A borderline app in my opinion. Just enough features to make it useful, almost enough faults to make me uninstall. The app tries to do it all and with this objective limits user control . I don't want reminders but it's more complex than it needs to be to change them. Can't easily add or delete menu items. I use more than one device but apparently the app won't allow two devices to log in simultaneously but there's no warning of this. App is ok, but could be much better
replyContent: Dear James, Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry that you have found the app difficult to use. It is currently undergoing user experience improvements for release in coming months. You are able to use two devices to log into the app.We will be happy to assist you with this. Please contact us:  medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au for further assistance.

content: Pretty lousy the app could not find at least one medication out of 13 that I scanned. Was unable to fill out field for reasons for taking medication. Too much friggin around with this. No thanks, I can put all info on my profile on the phone easy enough. Uninstall this one I think.
replyContent: Hi, We are sorry that you found the app difficult to use. We are working hard on continually increasing the number of barcode scan-able medicines on our medicines database. However, the majority of medicines can be found using the medicines finder. Please contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au for further assistance.

content: Continuously displays the 'spinning circle' when trying to e-mail medicine list or syncing with good wifi network/4G connection. Never times out and rarely e-mails or syncs. Have persisted for some years but doesn't really improve in these network issues. 12JUL2020: Reverting to v3.2.3 (2 updates back) allows the network connections/e-mail to work.
replyContent: Hi John Gibney, thank you for your feedback. Your issue is with our development team and we have responded to your email. We will be responding back to you today with a fix. For any further assistance, please contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au

content: No medicines found by scanning but ok inputting manually. Only shows 4 of my medicines instead of 8. How do I view the rest.
replyContent: Hi Sandra,  thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry that you've been having challenges adding medicines to the app. We are continually increasing the number of medicines that are barcode scan-able. However, the majority of medicines can be found on the medicine finder. If you require any further assistance, please contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au

content: Very helpful
replyContent: Hi Jeannette, thanks for your wonderful review of our app. We hope you continue to enjoy using it! Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Only a limited number of medicines found by scanning, but all were found by name search. No ability that i could see to print out the list which would be useful to carry in a wallet or purse. Entering date of birth seemed very tedious but the developer responded and explained the best way to get back to the year of birth which made it easy. Good response from the developer. Added a star!
replyContent: Hi there, thanks for the feedback - we'll work hard to increase the number of barcode-scannable medicines. Regarding entry of date of birth, it's best to firstly tap the '1980' at the top left-hand corner of the calendar pop-up so you can scroll to the relevant year of 1948. After this, you can easily select your birth date/month. Hope this helps.

content: It would be a helpful app however I wish the reminders could actually be set to make a sound/alarm. I cannot seem to find such option. I am not always looking at my phone or have it nearby to SEE a reminder.
replyContent: Hi Jacky G. You will need to go into the 'Manage apps' section of your Android phone's settings, find 'MedicineWise' app, tap 'Notifications' and tap 'Allow sound'. This should enable sounds to turn on for your MedicineWise app reminders. Can you please give this a try and contact us on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au if you need further help. Thanks

content: Can't print or save details to give to my doctors.
replyContent: Hi Tom, you can email yourself a copy of the following reports - medicines list, medicines activity log (detailing 'taken' doses), or measurements/tests. These reports can then be printed out and handed to your doctor. Please see the app's FAQs via the app Settings > FAQs. Please contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au if you need further help

content: OMG this app is sooooooo stupid i tried setting the up and gave up and uninstalled the app. usless as
replyContent: Hi Lyn, sorry to hear that you haven't had the best experience with setting up the app. Our Customer Service team at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au are on hand to assist you with any questions you may have with using the app. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Great app to store info
replyContent: Hi Alan, thanks for your wonderful review of our app. We hope you continue to enjoy using it! Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Does not even barcodes from any of my medicines requires a postcode for Australia when I am itinerant and officially don't have one! Two glaring problems that make me think little research was done!
replyContent: Hi Bruce, we apologise for the inconvenience. Our barcode scanner picks up many medicines, including the vast majority of prescription medicines, and we are working hard to increase the proportion of over-the-counter medicines that are scannable. We'll also review the mandatory postcode requirement for you. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Love it. I forget all the time to take my meds
replyContent: Hi Gaynor, thank you so much for your review! We hope you continue to enjoy using our app. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: I'm 73 and find this app great for meds reminders
replyContent: Hi Stephen, thank you for the fantastic feedback on our app. We hope you continue to enjoy using it! Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Neat app to organise your medications. You can also enter you blood pressure, sugar readings and generate a useful report for that. Well done NPS, I will certainly recommend it for my patients.
replyContent: Hi Ahmed, thanks so much for your support of the app and for spreading word of its value to your patients! We hope you continue to enjoy using our app. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: It's great - As a Hospital Pharmacist I will happily recommend it to patients 😃
replyContent: Hi Phillip, thank you for your fantastic feedback and support in recommending our app to your patients! Please reach out to us at info@nps.org.au if you have any further feedback. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: I can't access data. Had password reset still can't get in
replyContent: Hi Jeanette, sorry to hear that you are having issues with logging in. Do you mind contacting our Customer Service via either info@nps.org.au or (02) 8217 8700, and we can give you a hand with your issues. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Useless. All it does is crash repeatedly
replyContent: Hi Daron, sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with using our app. Do you mind contacting our Customer Service team at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so that they can look into your issues promptly? Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Good once ypu get used to it have been using for about 5 years
replyContent: Hi Roger, thanks for your ongoing support of our app. We are glad you are enjoying it! Regards, MedicineWise App Support Team.

content: I have issues logging on every time I use it. Takes forever to log in when it does. Most of the time I just give up waiting. Seemed ok first day of use but now I can never log in.
replyContent: Hi James, sorry for the inconvenience you are experiencing with the login process. Do you mind contacting our Customer Service via either info@nps.org.au or 02 8217 8700, and we can give you a hand with your issues. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: A bit basic really
replyContent: Hi Chris, sorry to hear that the app does not meet your needs. Please feel free to contact us on info@nps.org.au to provide us with specific feedback on how we can improve the app for you. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: App requested to sign up. Great. Asked to set PIN for security. Open the app, enter correct PIN then it asks to sign in again. Over the top security requirements.
replyContent: Hi Dean, we are sorry you are experiencing these issues with our with the sign-in process. This is a new bug that we are currently investigating a fix for. We will keep you posted on when we have a solution for this bug. Thank you for your patience on this matter so far. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: This app seemed great at the start offering helpful things like blood pressure reports etc. its now very frustrating. When trying to generate a report it goes into thinking mode and nothing happens. IT then asked me to log back in and when I did all medication data had gone. This app promises the world but doesn't deliver ☹️
replyContent: Hi Gordon, sorry to hear about this issue with generating reports. Can you please contact us on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so we can investigate your issue further. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Cannot add daily quantities of medication. Keeps blocking any quantities entered.Even the default is added as above. It defaults back to zero.Tapping the entry does nothing.
replyContent: Hi Richard, thanks for your last reply and your ongoing patience. Would you mind quickly sending us your email address via medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au as we can better trouble-shoot via email communications and even send you a video showing how the screen navigation should work on the quantities screen. Thanks, MedicineWise App Support

content: Had some problems with the update but these have resolved. It's actually now better than before. I can now email my medicines list without the header of the second page over writing the list at that point. Anyway, this is definitely the best app to keep all of your medicines together for when you need it.
replyContent: Hi Terry, thanks for updating us about your issues being resolved. We are glad that things are working smoothly for you now! Regards, MedicineWise App Support

content: na no good
replyContent:
Hi Caroline
If you'd like to email us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au with an outline of your issue, we'll see what we can do for you?
Thanks
Gamila

content: a very handy appI'll
replyContent: Hi Stephen, thanks for your wonderful review of our app. Hope you continue to enjoy it! Regards, MedicineWise App Support

content: i was getting notifications and all but now i dont get any so now i have forgotten to take some medication, not happy with the app anymore very disappointed, now ive updated it and still don't get any notifications whats going on this is stupid
replyContent:
Hi Belinda
We've seen your email in our support box and will assist you there.
Thanks
Gamila

content: Interesting changes, frustrated that you now have to enter password every time you log in.
replyContent:
Hi Peter
We're aware of this issue and are currently investigating. To make life a little less frustrating, if you go into settings from within the app, it's near the top right corner on the patient list, first option is Login and security, where you can set a pin instead of a password. Makes for easier re-entry.
Thanks
Gamila

content: very good app
very helpful when going to hospital or new doctor.

I use this app to keep track of and give accurate information on my many medications. Also great for when I attend hospital & specialists when they need to know all my meds & dosage. Great functional app.
your app is easy to work with
Very comprehensive app.
awesome app
love being able to keep medicine info on the phone so you can keep up to date with medications for your appointments
EXCELLENT
replyContent: Hi Jurgen, thanks for your rating! We hope you continue to enjoy using the app.

content: Cant use the app without signing in.
replyContent: Hi Aiden, thanks for your feedback. Our reasoning behind having an app registration and sign-in requirement is that this allows your data to be secured and backed up against your personal account - this is particularly useful where you lose your phone, as your medicines/medical data will be able to be easily restored from your account.

content: Good concept, but buggy execution.
replyContent: Hi Mark, we are happy to announce that we've just released a new update for the app, which fixes performance issues  associated with the reminders module in v3.2.1 - please download this from the Google Play Store and let us know if your problems persist. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: the app has great features and can add plenty of information, but no matter what I try I can't get it to give me a notification or reminder for when to take my tablets. I tried turning the reminders off and on, and I checked all the permissions but still can't figure it out.
replyContent: Hi Michael, we are happy to announce that we've just released a new update for the app, which fixes performance issues  associated with the reminders module in v3.2.1 - please download this from the Google Play Store and let us know if your problems persist. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Really helpful app, now i stay on top of my meds
only works when it wants to, was good 1 year ago, now hardly any reminders, Useless app now.
replyContent: Hi Jim, we are happy to announce that we've just released a new update for the app, which fixes performance issues  associated with the reminders module in v3.2.1 - please download this from the Google Play Store and let us know if your problems persist. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: absolutely worst app I have downloaded. Insufficient information supplied re setup. User unfriendly data input. Constantly requiring log in and recommencing data input. Have uninstalled.
replyContent: Hi Colin, sorry to hear you haven't had a great experience with using our app. We've noticed that you've emailed us about your specific issues, so we will try to help you through that particular channel. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: stupid app cant even log in after signing up.....uninstall
replyContent: Hi Ute Sarauer, we are sorry to hear that you are having issues logging in. If you are still willing to give the app a go, please contact us at info@nps.org.au or 02 8217 8700 for some troubleshooting assistance. Thank you, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Good app, have resolved daylight saving issue, but could you please add Noonan Syndrome to the list of health conditions?
replyContent: Hi Tammy, we're glad to hear that your daylight savings issue is resolved! We have just added Noonan's Syndrome to our list of health conditions, and you should be able to see this in the app from tomorrow. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: its a very good app for the total health record. please give a section of pulse also in Blood Preassure Measurment. like SYS / DIA / PULSE
replyContent: Hi there, thank you for your positive review of our app! We will add your suggestion to our list of future enhancements. Thankyou.

content: App has stopped notifications. Samsung Galaxy S8.
replyContent: Hi Martin & Jade, sorry to hear that your notifications have stopped. Can you please navigate in the app to 'Settings' then 'Reminders & Notifications' and ensure that the 'Medicine Notifications' toggle is turned ON? This should fix the problem. If you require more help, contact us at info@nps.org.au or telephone us on 02 8217 8700.

content: it used to be a great app but since the last update it doesn't notify me when to take my medication and now it displays all the times at once and you have to select which ones you took...I am about to uninstall it because im missing out on my medication and it's affecting my health....
replyContent: Hi Besim, we just want to update you that we are currently fixing this reminders bug and will be releasing a new update for the app by next week - please look out for this and let us know if your reminders issues persist after installing the update. Regards, MedicineWise App Support.

content: Fantastic app save me remembering all my requirements when filling out hospital forms which seems to be too often lately 😪
replyContent: Hi Darren, thanks for your positive review of our app! We aim to make your task of managing your medical information much easier, and we are glad we are achieving this goal!

content: I changed some settings and it seems to have solved the problem. I use this app all the time at doctors appointments etc. and find it invaluable thank you
replyContent: Hi Jeanette, we are glad the app is working well for you again. Thanks for your positive review of the app.

content: while this app is good, theres nowhere for me to view a history of the meds taken or when. rather i need to generate and email a report which is a bit pointless if i just want to see it onscreen.. also the medicine start and end dates dont bring up a calendar, rather is a text baded field?????
replyContent: Hi Jami, thanks for you review of the app. We will add your useful suggestions to our list of future enhancements. Thank you

content: Generally useful but it would be handy to be able to put in recurring appointments and also record health events such as scans and blood tests. My wife has just started chemo for pancreatic cancer and there are a lot of appointments and tests to remember. I guess it is primarily there for medicines - which it does well, but being able to put start and finish dates on the schedules that set the reminders accordingly would help a lot.
replyContent: Hi Peter, thanks for your feedback. We will look into implementing those suggested enhancements for future releases. In the meanwhile, you will be able to add appointment reminders called 'health reminders' from the Reminders module's drop down menu, and add custom tests from the 'Tests & Measurements' module by tapping its '+' button.

content: Keeps closing in the middle of trying to enter data. Sent feedback, but no reply from developers. Most recent update was 7 months ago. Uninstalling - it's not worth the trouble!
replyContent: Hi Janine. Apologies that the app is not working for you currently, and that you were not contacted earlier regarding this. To help troubleshoot further could you please contact us via email at info@nps.org.au or by phone on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: I am not always getting the reminders to take medication. And I am looking for a way to know what time I took a PRN medication and when it is next due, I do not take PRN meds at the same time every day, for it depends on when I need them.
replyContent:
Hi Lelly
We are in the middle of revamping the reminders section for the app, aiming to be released in mid feb. Hopefully this will resolve issues with reminders not always showing, but equally important is we have significantly improved our support for PRN meds and recording when doses were taken. 
Keep an eye out of the new release.
Thanks

content: Makes listing medications so much easier at a new doctor or hospital addmissions
Very useful app

I got this app so that I would get reminders for my meds, but the reminder apparently does not work for the Samsung Galaxy S7! Is this able to be fixed, if not I will need to look for an app that will give reminders. Cheers
replyContent: Hi Ellice. Apologies that medicines reminders are currently not working for you, it could be related to settings selection. To help troubleshoot further could you please make contact with us via email at info@nps.org.au or by phone on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: One of the best app I have sed so far
We'll this app was working great but it stopped working on my HTC U11 Life but just all of a sudden stopped working.
replyContent: Hi Rob. Apologies that the app is not working for you currently. To troubleshoot further, could you please make contact with us via email at info@nps.org.au or by phone on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: Was great to start with but if you add more than one or two people it becomes slow and lags. Also time out length is to short.
replyContent: Hi Kylie. Apologies that the app is lagging for you with multiple profiles. To troubleshoot further, could you please make contact with us via email at info@nps.org.au or by phone on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: After less than a week can't log on anymore. Logon only shows the progress circle. Want to delete App because it is still popping up reminders that I don't need anymore. What happens to my PII data I entered? How will it be deleted when I delete the app and it can't log on anymore?
replyContent: Hi Martin. We are sorry to hear that you cannot login. To troubleshoot further, could you please make contact with us via email at info@nps.org.au or by phone on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: Still hasn't improved when I first tried this app back in 2015. Snoozing notifications doesn't work, it just forgets to set another reminder. Some reminders are set to the year 1970. Some real basic programming issues overlooked. Disappointing.
replyContent: Hi Daniel. Thank you for providing this feedback, and apologies for the issues you have experienced. We would love to troubleshoot with you to fix these issues, would you be able to contact us via info@nps.org.au or by calling 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: If it doesnt like the input no clues could not add 1 person??? Last thing i need when under medical duress dont you get bloody testers to sort out the bugs
replyContent: Hi there. Apologies for the issues you have experienced. We would love to assist you in adding a profile and getting the most out of the MedicineWise app. Would you be able to contact us on 02 8217 8700 or email info@nps.org.au so we can troubleshoot further with you? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: Great app n very helpful
replyContent: Hi Michael. Thank you for your feedback! We are glad to hear that you find the app helpful.

content:
Easy to use and great if you have numerous medical issues. Makes new dr and 
hospital visits alot easier
replyContent: Hi Jenny. Thank you for your feedback - apologies that you have been unable to add allergies to your profile. We would like to assist you in troubleshooting so this can be resolved - could you please email us at info@nps.org.au or give us a call on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: The app won't email my medication list.
replyContent: Hi Jenny. Thank you for your feedback - apologies that you have been unable to email your medicine liste. We would like to assist you in troubleshooting so this can be resolved - could you please email us at info@nps.org.au or give us a call on 02 8217 8700? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content:
3 of my medications aren't in the application straight up. Pointless in 
managing a complicated / unique medical regime, maybe useful for a daily 
reminder system.
replyContent: Hi Sid. If a medication is not listed initially in the database, you can still add it to your medicines module by selecting "Tap 'Add' to add xxxx manually", in the orange section. This will act the same way as any medications that have been added from the database. If you need further assistance please email info@nps.org.au or call 02 8217 8700.

content:
It's a simple app to use. However, there appears the end date bug. Reminder 
still remind me to take the medication despite specifying an end date.
replyContent: Hi there, thank you for your comment. The start and end date fields are free text and as such cannot trigger reminders to stop. You will need to disable the reminder for that particular medicine. If you require assistance in doing this, please email info@nps.org.au or call 02 8217 8700. Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content:
Good digital record of medications.. great for visit to new 
doctor/hospital. Would love a proper diary function for past history. Would 
love to be able to sort by date and subject. I use Notes for this purpose 
but unwieldy doesn't work too well
replyContent: Hi Anne - thank you for your feedback. I have passed your suggestions on to our development team for review. Regards - MedicineWise App Team.

content:
Used to be decent. The PIN access broke it - PIN will fail intermittently 
and I won't be able to login for a few days. Secondly, and far more 
annoying - any time a reminder come us and the oauth token had expired 
it'll pop open the app regardless of what's going on in the phone. I have a 
reminder at 7am and my alarm is often set to go off at 7am - if they go off 
together this app will block access to the alarm and I have to restart my 
phone to silence the alarm. Rubbish.
replyContent: Hi Lucas. Apologies for the experience you have had with PIN functionality and also your reminders. We would like to discuss this further with you to assist you in resolving the issues. Could you please contact us via email at info@nps.org.au, or by calling 02 8217 8700. Thank you - MedicineWise App Team

content: Good app but every time I try to add one of my medications it crashes. Just this one medication. The others added fine.
replyContent: Hi Megan. Sorry to hear that your app is crashing when trying to add your medication. Is the app giving you any specific error messages? Also, could you advise if this is occurring when scanning a barcode, or entering the medication via text? If you could provide further information via email to info@nps.org.au - we'd really appreciate it!

content: Update medications crashes
replyContent: Hi John - apologies that you have experienced difficulty in the medication list update. The update can take some time depending on internet connection and device, however, would you mind emailing us at info@nps.org.au with some further details and screenshots if possible, so we can investigate this further for you? Regards, MedicineWise App Team

content: Useless app as screen overlay prevents me from using it. Won't let me change the settings.
replyContent: Hi Kylie. Apologies for the issues you're experiencing using the app. We'd like to further assist - so if you have a moment, could you please call us on 02 8217 8700 or send an email to info@nps.org.au, so we can troubleshoot with you? Regards - MedicineWise App Team

content: Well, after this latest update I will be ceasing to use this app as I'm the only user and now have to login via p.i.n  just to hit a reminder to say I've remembered to take my meds? What a p.i.t.a!
replyContent: Hi Darren. We apologise for your login issues affecting reminders. You can  prevent the need to login temporarily, by going into the app settings, tapping on Login and security, and disabling "App lock after 30 minutes of activity". This will work as long as you do not hard close the app (remove it from open apps). We hope this helps!

content: Disappointed in update - i now have to log in twice a day to check off of my medications as I take them. Previously I didn't need to log in and I could snooze a reminder. Reminders won't snooze as session keeps timing out.
replyContent: Hi Tracey. Thank you for your feedback, and apologies for the disappointment around our update. We would like to assist you in resolving your reminder issue; if you would be happy to email us at info@nps.org.au, we can assist you further. You can also feel free to give us a call on 02 8217 8700 (Monday - Friday (9AM - 5PM AEST). Thank you!

content: Thank for your prompt reply and support everything seems to be working now very impressed this app has been so useful as my partners medications and management has been so crucial
replyContent: Hi Arno. Please accept our apologies for the poor experience you have endured using our application. As discussed this morning, we are doing all we can to resolve this for you, and I will be in contact tomorrow with an update. Until then, please feel free to contact us should you require any further assistance, at info@nps.org.au. Have a great day!

content: I used to love this app but for 6 months I have been unable to log in. I have uninstalled it and reinstalled it and I keep getting "unknown data retrieval". My husband decided to try and install the app on his phone and log in with my details and he got in without a problem. Yet I still cannot log in and get the same message each time until it says "too many log in attempts". I have a new phone and it still gives me this error when I try to log in. I am appalled as I have needed to look up the medications for medical appointments and have been unable to. VERY UNHAPPY!!
replyContent: Hi Stina, sorry you've been experiencing these issues. We recommend you uninstall & then reinstall the new update (v3.0.3) of the app and try to log in with your account details. This hopefully will resolve the "something went wrong" login error message, and restore the visibility of the "forgot your password" and "sign up"  webpage links. Thanks.

content: I had previously deleted this app because of login problems and ongoing issues with locking up. I have now reinstalled the app (Feb 2018) and created a new account. Seems to be working OK. Still don't know what version I'm  running!
replyContent: Hi John, sorry to hear that you haven't had the best experience with the new app. We will reach out to you via email, so we can offer you more comprehensive support for the concerns you have raised in your post. Regards, MedicineWise App Support team.

content: While I find the app works OK (Samsung Galaxy S5) I find the need to log in with my email address is so frustrating that I tend not to use it. Why use the email address to log in? My email address is 25 characters long - why can't I just use a  name like Pete or Bill? Apart for this quirk I am happy with it.
replyContent: Hello, unfortunately it's not an option at present to login using a custom username like Pete or Bill. However, if you login in once with your email address & password, you should be able to stay logged in until you manually log out from Settings. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your positive experience with the app.

content: Very dissappointing. Installed on new phone and says password is wrong. Reset still says something went wrong
replyContent: Hi Yvonne, we're sorry that you've been experiencing this login issue. We can confirm that the 'something went wrong' bug affects logins made on phones subsequent to the first phone you've logged in on. We're currently investigating a fix for this and will likely deliver this in early 2018.  We appreciate your patience on this matter so far.

content: They fixed the reminder issue I had within good time. I really like this app. Good for Australians particularly.
replyContent: Hi Elisabeth, we're glad we could help you out promptly with you issue. Thanks for your positive review and we hope you continue to enjoy using this app. Kind regards, MedicineWise App Support Team.

content: Has Potential Installed yesterday. The ability to print medicine list would help as would an audit of supply - used = balance available. Adding general reminders cumbersome. Why is an email address mandatory. Have you asked a medical practitioner their email address? Also the app help goes nowhere. I am looking for a app that will do the job. As I have said has a lot of potential
replyContent: Hi Fred, thanks for your feedback. You can email a printable copy of your medicines list by tapping the 'overflow' menu (button with three vertically-aligned dots) on the 'Medicines' screen. We will take on board your suggestions to add supply monitoring, streamline general reminders and fix the mandatory medical practitioner email bug. Thanks.

content: Thanks for your reply. As a result reinstalled and reevaluating App. I hope it doesn't disappoint as I have grown to like this App over the years.
replyContent:
Hi Barry

Thanks for the feedback, and identifying the issue with reminders not being triggered if the phone has been turned off.
Regarding the vaccination functionality, we are aware that it is a feature that would be useful and it is on our roadmap.
Regards
MedicineList+ Support

content: Went from useful to just another hacker target holding my personal information. Stupid short sighted decision
replyContent: Hi David, we respect your information security and take many steps to protect it, as detailed in our Terms of Use. We introduced the login feature in response to customer requests for a solution that would better secure their data, allow them to restore app data from the cloud when they lose/switch phones, or use the app on multiple devices.

content: This app loses all information when installed on a new phone. When manually re-entering the medical practitioner information nothing will save unless you enter a valid email address (dont have one for the medicos). I am really disappointed.
replyContent: Hi Anne, when you install the app on a new phone, the initial sync may take a while (if you have lots of data), causing data to not appear until sync is completed - if the issue continues beyond the initial sync, please contact medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au. Also, we will be fixing the health professional 'email field' to make this 'non-mandatory'.

content: It started  of great for awhile  but for last week  it has stop reminding me to take my table and thats good  i have restart the but still not working not happy at all I have left a message  on the phone for some to ring me and i have sent email as but still nothing happened i need and app that i csn trust to remind me about my pills  as i forget to take them
replyContent: Hi there, we are sorry to hear that you are having issues with your reminders. Unfortunately our Customer Service team have not received your communications so far on this matter. Are you able to contact them via medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au or (02) 8217 8700 so they can start trouble-shooting your reminders issue straight away? Thank you.

content: I was extremely happy with this app and had shown it to numerous medicos who were all impressed that I had all of my medical information at my fingertips.  Now we have to login to use the app.   Worst decision ever!   I don't have access to the internet at home or when out at medical appointments. Having to log in has made this app unusable for me and I have made the decision to look for another app that better suits my needs.  There is zero need to login to use the app. Ok, IF (and it's a pretty big if) you want to sync across devices there MAY be a point but for general use, No, there is no point in having to log in. I would give this app 0 if I could.  I am very disappointed in this new requirement for this app.
replyContent: Hi TJ, thanks for sharing your concerns. Our users have long requested a way to sync & backup their app, which is useful when they lose/upgrade devices - our practical way to achieve this is via introduction of a login account to which your info is synced/backed up into. We do however apologise if this makes the app unsuitable for your situation.

content: Seems very slick and practical. Was wanting to use it to track my baby's weight however the report function doesn't generate the graph on a linear scale for date making it useless as the data becomes skewed.
replyContent: Hi Megan, thanks for your positive review of our app. We will add your feedback on our reports to our suggestions log for future enhancements. Regards, MedicineWise App team.

content: Great app, but when entering doctors details,  you are unable to save if you don't have their email address. Most doctors don't have this on their business card or if they are specialists at a hospital you dont have a business card and you are not given this information. It would be be better if you could save your doctors without having to add an email address.
replyContent: Hi Lou, thanks for highlighting this app bug for us. We agree that this email address field should not be mandatory for the health professional entry and will be looking at implementing a fix to this in a future release. Apologies for any inconvenience caused by this bug so far. Regards, MedicineWise App Support Team.

content: Typing in my log in and password.  It says simethi g went wrong. Please try again. Tried it few times. Never worked. Same msg everytime. Uninstalled and installed it again and agasin. Now have given up
replyContent: Hi Rama, thanks for providing the additional clarification on the error message. We are looking into the cause of this 'Something Went Wrong' error message and will touch base with you when we have further advice on the matter. Regards, MedicineWise app support team.

content: I had previously been very unhappy with this app and all its shortcomings but decided to reinstall it after learning that it now supports synchronisation across devices. It 's very much better and is in fact now quite usable and useful. I have therefore reconsidered my earlier review and 1 star rating. I'm giving it 5 stars for now but if I ever again have to wait more than 10 seconds while it updates its database it will be back down to 1 star and will again be uninstalled.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for giving our app another go and we are happy to hear that you are enjoying the use of it. We have taken on board your previous comments regarding the long time it takes to complete a medicines database update, and will  ensure that future updates will be quick and efficient. Regards, MedicineWise app support team.

content: Great app, am scared to update though in case I lose everything. If would be great if you could also record when you've taken PRN medication.
replyContent: Hi Alex, thanks for your positive review.  You can continue to use the old version of the app, however if you require data back-up & syncing, we recommend that you upgrade  - if you have any upgrade issues, please write to medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au or call (02) 8217 8700 for prompt help.  We will also take on board your PRN recording suggestion.

content: Was great app but since update all data gone,fix it or I will uninstall,I don't do mail just fix it😬
replyContent: Hi Jim, we suggest you go to your app settings, turn ON the 'Update over mobile network?' toggle, and then tap the manual sync button at the top of your profile list. Please let us know if this brings back your data. Our advice on this forum is character limited, so we often tell users to write to medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au for full support.

content: Since the log in update it keeps crashing and i can no longer see my med list
replyContent: Hi Liz, sorry to hear your issues regarding the app crashing. We have taken on board such reports and are investigating the matter as a priority. We've noticed you have also written to us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so our support team will be handling your matter closely from there.

content: Doesn't do anything after logging in want waste of time downloading it and creating a profile
replyContent: Hi Sandra, thanks for your feedback. After you create a profile on the app, you can start immediately adding your medicines, conditions, allergies and tests & measurements to that profile. We've seen that you've already written to medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au, so we can assist you with your concerns from there. Regards, MedicineWise App Support Team.

content: Sadly I will be deleting this one excellent useful app because of the changes. MedicineWise have confirmed that part of the reasoning for the new requirement for login is to enable this to store the Medicine list on their Cloud based system instead of on the phone that the app is installed on - some people (me included) regard our list of medicines that we take as very private data and most are not willing to have it stored online. In my opinion the sudden new requirements and change have been badly managed and the fact that everybody all of a sudden lost their reminders was unforgivable. I will be uninstalling the app unless the previous version is reinstated and the new version is rolled back. My medical privacy is more important to me than the developers wish to take my data online.
replyContent: Hi Sam, we're sorry you will be leaving us. We introduced the data sync & back-up solution (best facilitated via cloud storage) as it's our most requested enhancement from customers, who want to restore app data when they lose/switch phones, or need loved ones to access their data remotely. We'll always respect the privacy & security of your data.

content: New version wanted a login and to sync. This didn't work for first few times. Quits numerous times. Uninstalled it and will never use it again!!
replyContent: Hi Rae, we're sorry that you will no longer be using our new app. If you change your mind and would like to give it another go, please write to us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au where we can give you a hand with your login and sync concerns. Regards, MedicineWise App Support team.

content: What the hell happened.  This application worked well but after the secure login update the app no longer works.  Fix it quickly or I will uninstall.
replyContent: Hi Jamel, we apologise for any inconvenience caused by our new app. Could you please write to us at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so that we can help you with your specific concerns regarding the login process. Regards, MedicineWise App Support Team.

content: Was a great app. but with the new update stuffed everything lost my medicine list etc and can't log into new version same reason that have been listed  by other people was a great app why did you change it am very annoyed.
replyContent: Hi Cathy, we are sorry that your experience with our new app has not been up to expectations. Our team is available to help you with your specific login and data transfer issues - please write to medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so that we can assist you further. Regards, MedicineWise App Support team.

content: Nothing I scanned was in the database.
replyContent: Hi, although most prescription medicines are scannable by our app, unfortunately there are some (e.g. herbal & over-the-counters), which aren't. We understand your frustration and are currently enhancing our database of scannable medicines so you will have a better app experience in future. Regards, Medicinewise App Support Team.

content: A great app that was ruined by a recent update
replyContent: Hi Douglas, we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with the newest version of our app. We would appreciate if you could provide some specific feedback on this newest version to our support team at medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au so we can improve your app experience. Regards, Medicinewise App Support Team.

content: I had relied on this app to hold information I needed to remember. . Its  all lost.. Login Fails to work .. make it optional if you must. . Being clever screwed an otherwise excellent program.  It as slow a a wet week .. I  need a reliable and trust worthy medication application support. . This is NOT
replyContent: Hi Michael, we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with logging into the app. As you have written into medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au about this issue, we will be working with you closely via this support box to resolve your app issues. Regards, Medicinewise App Support Team.

content: It was a great app but the new login isn't working. I created an account but the app doesn't let me login.  Click on forgot password, enter my email address & it says their is no account with that address. Go to create new account, says email address already in use.
replyContent: Hi Michael, we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with logging into the app. Can you please contact us on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au or (02) 8217 8700 - we can check and reset your login credentials if necessary, so you can start using the app again. Regards, Medicinewise App Support Team.

content: Latest update logged me out and subsequently my reminder didn't occur this morning. I had come to rely on the app for knowing which day a particular drug was due.
replyContent: Hi James, we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues with the log-out feature and reminders on the latest update. Can you please contact us on medicinewiseapp@nps.org.au or (02) 8217 8700 so that we can help you immediately with your app issues. Regards, Medicinewise App Support Team.

content: AMAZING APP!!!!
Smart thing to do with all of your Rx's and OTC's with your Vitamins as well as herbs.

This is by far the best app that I have tried.. One thing that I would like to see added is a way to indicate that a med has been held. Many cardiac meds have parameters re Vital  Signs, when the med needs to be held. Thank you . RN MSN
Good
Crashes on android 4.2

Great app. I've been looking a long time for an app that fits my needs, the closest one I found before this was insufficient and frustrating. There's only two things I would add to/improve about this app. 1) I would allow alpha and symbol characters to be used in describing test results, 2) I would include a section for recording doctor visits, allowing you to record date/time, reason for visit, topics discussed, and conclusions reached.
great app. exactly what I was looking for. easy to use and navigate between family members is wonderful. thank you.
Great little app but it only has some of my supplements and medications that I take, available through search. Perhaps allow the app to connect to the internet to pull other information?
Great app.. I'm on 5 different medications and it keeps me organised so i dont forget to take them.
Love this app.  I 💗 how it reminds me of my meds especially the ones I don't take daily.   Would be great if I could keep just doctor appointments in here also.
Doesn't record medications actually taken, only sets up a reminder system.  Therefore of limited use when reviewing a person's medication history or establishing ongoing treatment.
So easy to  use  and a great  tool  to  download medication  list to  take  to different  doctors
Works well for me

I go to hospital a lot and they always ask for a list of my medications and me without a good memory just give them my phone they get my med conditions, meds, allergies and also all my specialist great app would not suggest any changes or additions its got everything THANKS DEVELOPER'S FOR THE BEST APP I'VE COME ACROSS
Daily

I needed an app to list my prescription meds and wanted one with no ads. This app does that very well and does more! I like the ability to link meds to conditions, and conditions to providers. It would be a great enhancement to see the provider that prescribed the medicine in the medicine list. It would also be great to add expected refill dates and reminders. Having the additional information about the medication available at a click is great as well. Great work!
I should have been suspicious when the preview pages didn't show an actual list of medications. If it's in there, I couldn't find it. Uninstalled and chose another app.
replyContent: Hi Janet, the ability to build and view your medicines list is the main feature of MedicineList+ - you must first enter the 'Medicines' module and tap '+' to start adding your medicines via pick-list or barcode scanning. We encourage you to give our app another go and we are happy to guide you through the process via medicinelistplus@nps.org.au.

content: A very good app. Easy to use. Everything you need in an meds app.
Best
All medicine prescribed

Very handy as I care for my elderly mother and am often asked for a list of which medications she takes. Ability to scan barcodes is great.  Enhancement suggestion: ability to add  health practitioner details straight from phone contacts.

Despite the update, this supposedly updated version still crashes when I want to note that I have taken a particular medication. The fact I can't reliably use what was once a properly working app makes this app useless to me because it is not reliable. Please fix it ASAP and please NEVER release an app update with bugs because it's just not worth the pain or hassle. We'd all rather use an older version that works than suffer through weeks or months of pain. Thank you -please fix ASAP, thank you.
replyContent: Hi Mary, we are sorry that v2.8 of MedicineList+ has not provided a fix to your reminders problem. We have just released v2.9 today, which provides a fix for the reminders problem and hopefully will restore the app's reliability for you. Please write to medicinelistplus@nps.org.au if you have any further issues. Regards, MedicineList+ Support Team

content: What a waste of time... this thing doesn't recognize any medications with  scanning furthermore when you try to search for them by typing in the name of the medication no medications are known in the database what kind of mucous list are you medicine list plus if you have no medications in your lists? Boo, you suck!
replyContent:
Hi Regina
Sorry for the inconvenience that this has caused. Are you based in Australia? Currently we only have Australian medicines in the app. If you are searching for an Australian medicine, could you please contact us at medicinelistplus@nps.org.au with the name of the medicine so we can investigate why it isn't found.
Regards
Gamila

content: It was working fine and now is a dud. no reminders and crashes on certain screens. I've emailed repeatedly and been told an update was coming two weeks ago but no update is forth coming. Very disappointing.
replyContent: Hi Susan, sorry for the inconvenience caused to you by the reminders problem. You may be pleased to hear that we have just released v2.9 today, which fixes the reminders problem and hopefully will improve your experience with using our app. Please write to medicinelistplus@nps.org.au if you have further issues. Regards, MedicineList+ Support Team

content: Reminders don't work.
replyContent: Hi Melanie, apologies for the inconvenience caused to you by the reminders problem. We would like you to know that we have just released v2.9 today, which fixes the reminders problem. Please write to medicinelistplus@nps.org.au if you have further issues. Regards, MedicineList+ Support Team

content: Good
The scanner won't work... plz fix ASAP
replyContent:
Hi Steve
We don't currently have barcodes for all products, if the app doesn't find it, it means we haven't added it yet, however you should be able to add the medicine by searching and other products should work.

Thanks
Gamila 
MedicineList+ Support.

content: I have multiple medications to take at certain times. Unable to select which ones have been taken and which ones missed. Have had to disable reminders as can't finalise them. Very frustrating.
replyContent: Hi Kathy, we are very sorry for the inconvenience that was caused by the reminder bugs in the previous releases of the app. After much work, we are proud to report that we have released a new v2.9 today that resolves these issues. Please write to medicinelistplus@nps.org.au if you have further issues. Regards, MedicineList+ Support Team

content: Now it keeps failing and I'm not getting any reminders.
replyContent: Hi Sheryl, we are very sorry for the inconvenience caused by the reminder bugs in previous versions of the app. We have released a new v2.9 today that resolves these bugs. Please write to medicinelistplus@nps.org.au if you find any further issues. Regards, MedicineList+ Support Team

content: The reason  I downloaded this was to check for interactions not bloody reminders. Uninstalling and calling a pharmacy instead.
replyContent:
Hi C JayKay, you are correct, at this point in time we don't have interaction warnings, talking to your pharmacist or doctor is the best source of information if you have concerns around drug interactions.
You can access consumer medicines information leaflets from within the app, which provide a nice summary of the medicine and side effects.

content: Have uninstalled this as tend micro has found grayapps in with this I have uninstalled
replyContent:
Hi Peter
That is quite concerning. Does your trend micro scan provide an output file? It would be great if you could send it through to our support line medicinelistplus@nps.org.au so that we can investigate and provide a fix if necessary.

Regards
MedicineList+ Support

content: this is good  app to some what? as i have seen before i do cross reference my scripts from my doctor to see what ingredients ,drug class and uses etc.......
replyContent:
Hi John
You can use MedicineList+ to keep track of the medicines you are taking, if you need help remembering when to take them, you can set reminders and also record other health information like conditions and any allergies you have.
There are tutorials which you can turn back on, by navigating to settings from the main screen. Good luck\

content: Medicine List isn't downloading
replyContent:
Hi Katie
On the first time, it will need to load an updated database for the medicines search.
As you are on an S2, this could take 20mins. Once you've tapped on the medicines section, it will trigger the download and you can keep using your phone, check back later and it should be ready. Sorry about the inconvenience. 

MedicineList+ Support

content: Hard
First aid
Love this app
Application

I was going to put in 5 stars because of first use/appearances. The info is great. The app, however, needs these changes:  1. The ability to access my medicines list no matter what. The near constant "Medicine database is currently being updated" message on pressing the "Medicines" button is stopping me from confirming my medications or sending my usage history to my GP. This is not acceptable. 2. The ability to report on what I've taken and when. I would like to bring it up on the screen OR access it from
Not a bad app, however if the reminder actually told you which medicine it was for it would be so much better, as opposed to having to open the app each time.
replyContent:
Hi Noeleen
We did consider that feature, however we felt that privacy was more important. Some people are very caution about their medicines, and we didn't want you to be lending your phone to someone and the medicine name appear, but we will reconsider this design in the future.
Thanks
MedicineList+ Support

content: Very educational
What's this app?
Very informative and educative. Love it

When a dose is taken, the amount taken and when should be recorded. Regular meds where the dose time and amount doesn't change are fine. Irregular meds such as painkillers where things can vary should be allowed for. For ckd patients, phosphate binder dosage varies with the amount and frequency of meals/snacks and portion sizes.
Great app very easy to use☺
Such a handy app. With all the different specialists and gp's I have to see I can use this app for quick reference.

I love this app! Really helpful info. Very informative. Love it so much that have told hubby and other family members to get it.  I like that it is overseen by a government body too,so everything is above board.
Any backup or sync data should be added as this is related to data saving. Make this app more reliable and trustable to save the info.
replyContent:
Hi Teddy
Thanks for that feedback, we are planning to include this feature as part of our next major build.

However that build will be many months away, I hope it doesn't inconvenience you too much in the mean time.

MedicineList+ Support

content: A nice app to keep track of your medications & other medical information. But there is currently no way to backup or sync the information entered. This is annoying when a new device is purchased or where you use more than one device since re-entering the information is time consuming. Could this issue be addressed?
replyContent:
Hi Queenie,
We are looking at including this feature in our next major build.
We are aware that everyone expects their apps to handle the data back up for them.

MedicineList+ Support

content: App generally does as it states but I have one issue where I tried to send my medicine list to email and it was disallowed for some reason and only the email went without the PDF. Not sure if you can email the PDF or even save medicine list as PDF; some help please :-)
replyContent:
Hi David
This is now fixed, please update your app
Thanks 
MedicineList+ Support

content: I'll start by saying it's not perfect, some areas could be improved upon but it still gets a 5🌟 rating because of its functionality. It's the right tool for the job if you have multiple medicines/medicinal schedules, health conditions and a family or household to keep track of. My wife&I not only care for our own health issues but also care for an elderly uncle and disabled sister.It's got information on medicines available in Australia and one can immediately share all relevant information with Dr's etc
It's hard. It's only been the last 2,3 years taking tablets. Before then had no tablets and now I pay $80, or a $150 a monthly and that's $25 a month to deliver my tables every Thursdays.
Best App For Anyone Who Has Major Health Problems & On Heaps Of Meds. :-)
I used to forget my medicines. Not anymore. Thanks! The updates are frequent too. Great to see android apps of high quality.
I find the app lessens my concerns about my healthcare. I also carry my husband's records.
Medical expertise.
Great app.
Excellent all round s4lf health recorder
Handy as
This is a real handy app, but the alarms keep failing. Reloaded the app and they worked for a couple of days but failed again. Still a good app though.
similar to BarrySuzy I find that the reminders do not work while the phone is locked.
Being a busy person and a carer, it helps me make sure I dont make any mistakes.  Thanks

Date start and stop should be linked to calendar so short term med reminder don't go on indefinitely. Separate short and long term meds would be helpful eg with antibiotics. Med list with active ingredients keeps reverting to brand name. Would be better with expanded barcode scanner.
replyContent:
Hi Melissa
We are aware that the date start and stop isn't as useful as it could be in its current incarnation, we will be reviewing this in the next major build due later this year.
You are right the medicines list does automatically revert to sorting by brand name, we'll keep in mind the desire to keep last user selection.

Regards
MedicineList+

content: easy way to track my medications

Finally I have an app that understands all my medication's Australian names.  I also have my elderly mum's details on here too - it would have been great to have had the info that can be stored here, all the previous times mum had been admitted to hospital. I suspect it will be so much easier now for me to supply info to doctors and administrators.

Excellent app, no more excuses about  forgetting to take them.  Please include info about the actual medicines themselves.  Edit: Awesome to see DEV actually implementing the feedback by adding links to the medicines which will give users more information about side effects etc. Good WORK - 5 star indeed !
replyContent:
Hi Hari
Thanks for letting us know your thoughts.
There is a new release that should be available tomorrow, which includes a link to the consumer medicine information leaflet, which tells you about the side effects of a particular medicine, what it is used for and how to use it, I hope this is the kind of information you need.
MedicineList+ Support

content: Suggestions: add a line for the doctor’s name who prescribed the medicine. Add way to move the medications in the list so that you can organise them in the way that you want them displayed, if alphabetical is not right for you. When I added a medicine on my own, it put it at the bottom of the list even tho it started with the letter “b” and other letters are in the list that are past that letter. It also does not leave the medicine name capitalized, even tho it is typed in that way. Enjoy it very much.
replyContent:
Hi Earl,
Thanks for your feedback. 
There is a new release that should be available tomorrow that has the ability to sort the medicines list by brand, active ingredient or date added, but it doesn't have the ability to individually tap and drag the medicines. 
Thanks for the thoughts about including the doctors name.
MedicineList+ Support

content: Excellent app,Easy to use thank you NPS
Love how much it's easy to setup your medicines... Especially with the barcode scanner.
Beautifully designed useful app. Use it and be medicine wise.
I used it to record my Dad's medicines. Now when he goes to his Specialist he has a complete list of what he is taking and when. It makes it easier for the specialist to adjust his medicines.
It works well and reminders work,  never forget to take your medicine again lol
Good app to keep track of medicine
